intro: Thibaudia setigera, commonly known as the slender thibaudia, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are typically ovate with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Thibaudia setigera is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along riverbanks.
